etymology.description: 大力 + 士 = person of great strength.
etymology.interpretation: Denotes someone possessing exceptional physical power, like a circus strongman or weightlifter. Can also be used figuratively for someone who can take on heavy responsibilities.

parts.english: great strength; with great force; vigorously; strongly

examples.chinese: 那位大力士在马戏团里举起了巨大的杠铃(那位大力士在馬戲團裡舉起了巨大的槓鈴)。
examples.pinyin: Nà wèi dàlìshì zài mǎxìtuán lǐ jǔqǐ le jùdà de gànglíng.
examples.english: That strongman lifted a huge barbell in the circus.

examples.chinese: 他从小就被称为大力士(他從小就被稱為大力士)。
examples.pinyin: Tā cóng xiǎo jiù bèi chēngwéi dàlìshì.
examples.english: He has been called a strongman since childhood.

examples.chinese: 公司需要一个推进项目的“大力士”(公司需要一個推進項目的「大力士」)。
examples.pinyin: Gōngsī xūyào yí gè tuījìn xiàngmù de “dàlìshì”.
examples.english: The company needs a ‘strongman’ to push the project forward.
